extracted_rules.rule: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Television and Radio Antennas

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the protrusion of television and radio antennas above the maximum building height in relation to the daylight plane.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to television and radio antennas.

Conditions.Mandatory: The protrusion must not exceed 15 feet above the maximum building height.
Conditions.Dependencies: Depends on the definition of 'maximum building height' which is likely defined elsewhere in the code.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case under the general 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
Relationships.Cross-references: Implicit reference to the code section defining 'maximum building height'.

extracted_rules.rule: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Chimneys and Flues

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the protrusion of small chimneys and flues into the daylight plane.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to chimneys and flues that are less than 5 feet wide.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Chimneys and flues 5 feet wide or wider.

Conditions.Mandatory: Chimney or flue width must be less than 5 feet.
Conditions.Optional: The protrusion itself is optional ('may extend').
Conditions.Conditional Logic: IF width < 5 feet, THEN protrusion is allowed only to the extent necessary to meet the minimum required clearance of Building Code (Chapter 16.04).
Conditions.Dependencies: The allowable protrusion extent is dependent on the requirements of Building Code (Chapter 16.04).

Exceptions.Explicit Deviations: This rule provides an explicit deviation, allowing a protrusion beyond the daylight plane to meet other code requirements.
Exceptions.Special Cases: This rule is a special case for meeting building code safety requirements for clearance.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case under the general 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: The allowance is logically dependent on the external requirements of the Building Code.

extracted_rules.rule: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Dormers, Roof Decks, Gables

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the protrusion of certain architectural features like dormers, roof decks, and gables into the daylight plane.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to dormers, roof decks, gables, or 'similar architectural features'. AMBIGUITY: The term 'similar' is not defined.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Features not meeting the specified dimensional and separation criteria.

Constants.Numerical Values: Max individual length: 7.5 feet; Max cumulative length: 15 feet (per side); Min separation: 5 feet (per side); Max height: 24 feet

Conditions.Mandatory: All dimensional and separation constraints must be met simultaneously. 1) each feature length ≤ 7.5'; 2) cumulative length of all features ≤ 15' (per side); 3) min 5' separation between features (per side); 4) height ≤ 24'. AMBIGUITY: The context for 'height ≤ 24'' is unclear (e.g., height of the feature, height above roof, etc.).
Conditions.Conditional Logic: A feature may protrude IF (length <= 7.5') AND (cumulative_length <= 15') AND (separation >= 5') AND (height <= 24').
Conditions.Dependencies: The cumulative length and separation rules are applied 'on each side', implying a dependency on the definition of a building 'side' or facade.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case under the general 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
Relationships.Cross-references: Figure 20 on p. 26, Figure 23 on p. 28
Relationships.Logical Dependencies: The conditions for individual features are logically linked via an AND operator.

extracted_rules.rule: Daylight Plane Protrusion: Cornices and Eaves

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the protrusion of non-habitable architectural features like cornices and eaves into the daylight plane.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Applies to cornices, eaves, and 'similar architectural features'. AMBIGUITY: The term 'similar' is not defined.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Explicitly excludes 'flat or continuous walls or enclosures usable for interior space'.

Variables.Usage: The feature must not be 'usable for interior space'.

Conditions.Mandatory: Protrusion must not exceed 2 feet. The feature must not be a flat/continuous wall or an enclosure for interior space.
Conditions.Conditional Logic: A feature may protrude IF (protrusion_depth <= 2 feet) AND (is_not_usable_for_interior_space).

Relationships.Hierarchical: This rule is a specific case under the general 'Allowable daylight plane protrusions' regulation.
